summary_sent: Prospects were dim for resolution of the political crisis in Cambodia in October 1998.
best-avg-rouge-01: 0:Cambodian leader Hun Sen on Friday rejected opposition parties' demands for talks outside the country, accusing them of trying to ``internationalize'' the political crisis.
best-avg-rouge-02: 6:It is detrimental to the sovereignty of Cambodia,'' he said.
best-avg-rouge-03: 4:``I would like to make it clear that all meetings related to Cambodian affairs must be conducted in the Kingdom of Cambodia,'' Hun Sen told reporters after a Cabinet meeting on Friday.

summary_sent: Prime Minister Hun Sen insisted that talks take place in Cambodia while opposition leaders Ranariddh and Sam Rainsy, fearing arrest at home, wanted them abroad.
best-avg-rouge-01: 2:Opposition leaders Prince Norodom Ranariddh and Sam Rainsy, citing Hun Sen's threats to arrest opposition figures after two alleged attempts on his life, said they could not negotiate freely in Cambodia and called for talks at Sihanouk's residence in Beijing.
best-avg-rouge-02: 8:Ranariddh and Sam Rainsy have charged that Hun Sen's victory in the elections was achieved through widespread fraud.
best-avg-rouge-03: 10:Hun Sen said on Friday that the opposition concerns over their safety in the country was ``just an excuse for them to stay abroad.''
